info.name: CardTest
info.description:
This collection contains requests to allow for:

- User Authentication
    
- Card CRUD operations
    

The requests allow for the full functionality of the Card Service.

# Prerequisites

Ensure at least Java version 17 is installed on the host machine to enable the build process for the jar file.  
You may optionally have maven (latest) installed as well.  
The application uses port 8081 and the database uses port 5431. Ensure the ports are free and accept tcp connections. If not you will need to modify the application.properties file to reflect the database port you wish to use, the Dockerfile to modify the exposed application port, and the docker-compose.yml file to modify both the database and application ports to the desired ones.  
Ensure docker is installed on the host machine.  
Ensure the host machine is connected to the internet.

# Configuration

Clone the repository from the command line if git is installed in your system using 'git clone [https://github.com/Ian-Ag-96/CardTest.git'](https://github.com/Ian-Ag-96/CardTest.git') or any other cloning mechanism you may wish to use.  
Navigate to the directory where the project resides and open the command line/terminal.  
Run the command 'mvn clean install -DskipTests' if maven is already installed or 'mvnw clean install -DskipTests' - (Windows) or './mvnw clean install -DskipTests' (Linux) if it is not installed. We are skipping tests because we want to only build the jar file. A container called 'card_test_tests' will be created later on for specifically running tests.  
After the jar file has been built successfully, ensure docker is running first then run the command 'docker-compose up --build' to download the necessary files, handle configurations, create all the containers, and start the application, including running tests. This may take some time as maven will have to be installed including its dependencies to handle tests.  
For specific cases you may use the following commands:  
'docker-compose up database' to only start the database and initialize the data  
'docker-compose up app' to start the application and database without running tests  
'docker-compose up test' to run the tests only

# Users

There are preloaded users in the database from the sql file 'card-test.sql':

```
- Admin user
    email: 'adminone@administrators.com'
    password: 'admin1234'
- Member user
    email: 'memberfour@allmembers.com'
    password: 'member1234'

 ```

# Documentation

The documentation can be found on this link: [https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/41252801/2sAYdZvaLy](https://documenter.getpostman.com/view/41252801/2sAYdZvaLy)  
The documentation is done using Postman.  
Requests can be found in the file 'CardTest.postman_collection'

# Extras

An API, though out of scope, for creating users is also included in the service.

item.name: Login Requests

request.description: Authenticates a User and provides an authentication token if successful

response.name: Login - Success
Login - Failure - Missing Email
Login - Failure - Empty Email
Login - Failure - Empty Password
Login - Failure - Missing Password
Login - Failure - Bad Credentials
Login - Failure - User Non Existent

item.description: These requests allow for authentication of a user and upon successful authentication, an OAUTH 2 bearer token is provided for subsequent requests that require authentication.

item.name: Database Connection Requests

request.description: Returns a success message if connection to the database is successful.

response.name: DB Connection - Success

item.description: A request to test the database connection.

item.name: User Requests

request.description: Creates a user for the card operations.

response.name: CreateUser - Failure - User Already Exists
CreateUser - Success
CreateUser - Failure - Missing Email
CreateUser - Failure - Missing Password
CreateUser - Failure - Missing Role
CreateUser - Failure - Invalid Role
CreateUser - Failure - User Creator Not Admin
GetCurrentUser - Success

item.description: Requests for user creation, and getting the current user's details from the bearer token.

item.name: Card Requests

response.name: CreateCard - Success
CreateCard - Failure - Missing Name
CreateCard - Failure - Card Already Exists
CreateCard - Failure - Wrong Color Format
UpdateCardDetails - Success
UpdateCardDetails - Failure - Missing Update Parameters
UpdateCardDetails - Failure - Missing Card Name
UpdateCardDetails - Failure - Invalid Color Format
UpdateCardDetails - Failure - Invalid Status
UpdateCardDetails - Failure - Non Existent Card
UpdateCardDetails - Failure - Unauthorized User
UpdateCardName - Success
UpdateCardName - Failure - Missing Old Card Name
UpdateCardName - Failure - Missing New Card Name
UpdateCardName - Failure - Same Old and New Card Names
UpdateCardName - Failure - Invalid User For Card Update
UpdateCardName - Failure - Non Existent Card
UpdateCardName - Failure - Unauthorized User
DeleteCard - Failure - Missing Card Name
DeleteCard - Failure - Non Existent Card
DeleteCard - Failure - Invalid User For Deletion
DeleteCard - Success
GetAllCards - Success - Member
GetAllCards - Success - Admin
GetAllCards - No Cards Found

request.description: request for fetching a single card by name

response.name: GetSingleCard - Failure - Unauthorized Card Accessor
GetSingleCard - Failure - Missing Card Name
GetSingleCard - Failure - Non Existent Card
GetSingleCard - Success

item.description: These are CRUD operations for card objects.
